inlineContent.text: Some of the properties can be modified. Not all properties exist for all files. For example, if a file is located on a volume that doesn’t support creation dates, the creationDate property will return nil.

abstract.text: The properties of a file system resource.
A bool indicating whether the resource is a regular file rather than a directory or a symbolic link.
A bool indicating whether the resource is excluded from backups.
Creation date of the resource.
The download date of the resource.
The total allocated size on-disk for the file.
A bool indicating if the resource is system-immutable.
The volume properties of a file system resource.
User-visible type or “kind” description of the resource.
A bool indicating if the resource is executable.
Number of hard links to the resource.
An object for reading and writing extended attributes of a file system resource.
A bool indicating if the resource is user-immutable.
A bool indicating if the resource is a volume.
The type of the fresource.
The label number assigned to the resource.
A bool indicating if the resources filename extension is removed from the localizedName property.
The volume properties of the resource.
The resource’s parent directory, if any.
The icon stored with the resource.
The date the resource was created, or renamed into or within its parent directory.
The optimal block size when reading or writing this file’s data, or nil if not available.
Describes where the resource was obtained from. For example download urls.
Creates an object for accessing and modifying properties of the resource at the specified url.
Date the resource was last accessed.
The total file size.
File system path to the resource.
The user-visible label text of the resource.
The total allocated size of the file.
A bool indicating whether the resource is a Finder alias file or a symlink.
A bool indicating whether the system is uploading the resource.
Date the resource content was last modified.
Date the resource’s attributes were last modified.
The label color of the resource.
A bool indicating if the resource is a directory.
The normal icon for the resource.
The type of a file.
Localized or extension-hidden name  as displayed to users.
The download status of the resource.
A bool indicating whether data is present in the cloud for the resource.
A bool indicating if the resource is normally not displayed to users.
A bool indicating whether the system is downloading the resource.
A bool indicating whether the resource is a file system trigger directory.
The url to the resource
A bool indicating whether the resource is scriptable. Only applies to applications.
A bool indicating if the resource is a packaged directory.
A content type identifier tree of the resource.
A bool indicating whether the resource has outstanding conflicts.
Swift Foundation extensions and useful classes & utilities.
A bool indicating if the resource is a isymbolic link.
Name of the resource in the file system.
A bool indicating if the resource is writable.
The attributes of a file.
The properties of a file system resource.
A bool indicating if the resource is readable.
A bool indicating whether the resource is in the iCloud storage.
The total displayable size of the file.
A content type identifier of the resource.
